attributes.action: Invite Vladimir Putin to the UK to discuss UK-Russia relations
attributes.background:
Britain's most famous Prime Minister Winston Churchill said "Jaw Jaw is better than War War". 
If he refuses to come it will speak volumes. If he does come maybe we can avert a tit-for-tat escalation.

attributes.action: Lower the legal sex age to 15 years of age.
attributes.background: The president of the Faculty of Public Health, said the current legal limit prevented sexually active younger teenagers from getting support with issues of disease and contraception with official figures indicating that as many as a third of all 15 year olds are having sex in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: It would also make it easier for 15 year olds who are already having sex to obtain contraception or sexual health advice from the NHS.

attributes.action: Make car insurance companies give their "BEST PRICE" when they send your renewal
attributes.background:
I received my car insurance renewal and it went up by £100, I shopped around and got a better price, I then called my current insurers and following some haggling they dropped the premiums by 23%.
I want the government to make insurers give their "BEST PRICE" on the renewal and not make you haggle

attributes.action: Ban diesel cars, post-Brexit
attributes.background: Diesel NOx cheating kills 23,500 UK people a year prematurely, at 10 times the USA’s gun death rate. The UK cannot wait 23 years and see 540,500 die early. We must follow the Germans and ban diesels immediately Post-Brexit.
attributes.additional_details:
Last July, the UK banned diesel cars by 2040, because EU diesel testing failure had worsened breaching of NOx targets. Many German cities exceed EU limits. So, last February, Germany’s highest court ruled that cities can ban the worst diesels.

Car makers and politicians move between both spheres in Germany, the major EU budget contributor. It got EU CO2 regulations to favour diesel, ignoring NOx. VW cheated on emission testing. With 3 jailed, police are investigating 3 of VW’s top people.

attributes.action: Disallow Schools To Confiscate Mobile Phones
attributes.background: Schools should not be allowed to confiscate items such as mobile phones. Mobile Phone are necessary to a child's learning, it lets the student to enhance the internet, release stress, contacts friends for social support and let's parents and carers now where their child is and if they are ok.
attributes.additional_details: Yes, Phones can be a distraction meaning students must not use them in class but a teacher must not confiscate them. What are students suppose to do if they are in trouble walking home? What if they need to go to a friend's due to an emergency? What if the parent needs to contact the child but does not know where they are and who to ring?

attributes.action: Changes required under the Universal Credit to support workers!
attributes.background:
make uploading documentation for childcare costs or any other evidence available online - this will enable working families to upload in a timely manner!

monies to be paid in advance for childcare costs as ALL nurseries UK wide require advance payment!!
attributes.additional_details: I am a single mother to 2 under 3's who works as a manager but is newly single and having to rely on a system whether the childcare costs and housing costs have not been paid for the last 2 months leaving me in a very difficult situation that nobody else (IN WORK) SHOULD GO THROUGH!

attributes.action: Make two modest but sensible precautions in case Brexit goes badly.
attributes.background:
Precaution 1.  Hold a post-Brexit referendum on whether to return to the EU.  

Precaution 2.  Ensure our Brexit Terms include the right for a "fast-track" return of the UK to the EU, ideally under pre-Brexit conditions.
attributes.additional_details:
If that new shirt doesn’t quite fit, we can return it to the shop.  To make sure we don’t lose those precious family photos, we back-up the laptop from time to time. 

So if rights-of-return and back-up plans make sense for an individual, shouldn't a nation of 65 million people have a contingency plan just in case Brexit is not the resounding success we all hope for?

No-one on either side of the argument has a crystal ball, so can we afford not to have an insurance policy in our back pocket?

attributes.action: Stop introducing fixed tenancies to tenants
attributes.background: New legislation is putting forward that fixed term tenancies will be given to everyone who is signing a new tenancy. This means tenants with existing secure tenancies will loose their secure tenancy example through mutual exchange and through the bidding system.
attributes.additional_details: Tenants are given opportunity to move through mutual exchange and being forced to give up their secure tenancy because they need extra space or to downsize. Now it’s a choice of quality of living or a secure tenancy. With these new laws coming in no one is secure people with vulnerability should be excempt from these laws. It would be better that those who need to move through mutual exchange should keep their existing tenancy status ie secure tenancy and move that over to the swapper property.

attributes.action: Stop 'Treatment Without Consent' in the Mental Health Act
attributes.background: If patients with physical illnesses such as cancer can refuse treatment mental health patients should also be able to do the same. The current practice of using the Mental Health Act to force treatment is coercive and a violation of the autonomy of the patient.
attributes.additional_details: The current practice of psychiatry is almost exclusively based on a biochemical model. The outcome of this is that medication is seen as the only credible resort when treating patients suffering from psychotic illness. When patients suffer side effects they are seen as non-compliant and when they stop medication they are placed on CTOs. This violates the patient's autonomy to make decisions for themselves about their treatment.

attributes.action: Re-run the appointments process for the board of the Office for Students
attributes.background: The Commissioner for Public Appointments has identified serious governance failings and political interference in the appointment of board members of the new Office for Students. All board members should be asked to immediately resign and the appointments process be re-run in  proper manner.
attributes.additional_details: The full report of the Commissioner can be accessed here: https://publicappointmentscommissioner.independent.gov.uk/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/Commissioner-for-Public-Appointments-Investigation-OFS-Final-.pdf

attributes.action: Allow non-UK citizens to vote in general elections after 5 years of UK residence
attributes.background: We want all non-EU/non-commonwealth citizens living in the UK to have full voting rights (including in general elections) after 5 years of residence. In order to create a truly representative government we must include the opinions of these people who make up approximately 8% of the UK population.
attributes.additional_details: I recently discovered that non-EU citizens are ineligible to vote in UK general elections, and on further research that non-commonwealth citizens have no voting rights at all. It seems wrong that people who have lived and worked in the UK for a considerable period have no say in their futures. There has been a drastic increase in hate crimes towards foreigners in the UK since the Brexit vote, and making them more a part of our society can only help to make them feel more welcome.

attributes.action: Minimum sentences for using physical violence or brandishing weapons.
attributes.background: On a regular basis my colleagues and I are subjected to physical aggression and attacked in the course of our lawful duty. We want minimum custodial sentences brought in so when we are attacked in our workplace or have weapons brandished against us we will have confidence in the justice system.
attributes.additional_details:
On 3 seperate occasions I personally have had knives pulled on me during the execution of warrants issued by HMCTS. On 2 occasions the police refused to arrest as they said there is no point and on the 1 occasion they did the offended was issued a £50.00 fine (which they never paid) with no other punishment at all. 

This is a story that is all too common in our workplace and I feel a minimum sentence should be introduced to provide justice to all frontline workers attacked or threatened.

attributes.action: Ban gas stunning of animals
attributes.background: Gas stunning is a cruel method of killing animals. A video on YouTube made me aware of this horrid way animals are killed everyday. It should be made illegal.

attributes.action: Increase nhs staff awareness and training on the signs and symptoms of sepsis
attributes.background:
I have since heard of many other cases of children with sepsis being misdiagnosed having gastroenteritis, sometimes with long term effects. 
I want government to look at this issue and increase training awareness within the nhs to prevent more unnecessary child deaths or life changing effects.
attributes.additional_details:
Our son, had severe leg pain, a very high temperature, vomiting and neck stiffness. We called 111 who sent us an ambulance to a and e. When we arrived, were seen by the doctor, he took a brief look over our son and asked of his symptoms. We said the symptoms, then he concluded that it could be gastroenteritis. He said we could take him home if he could keep some food down, which he did. However I said I was very concerned as he could not sit up unaided at this point and I would like another opinion. The paedeatrician came and immediately suggested meningitis and sepsis. He took bloods immediately and put our son onto strong antibiotics (this saved his life). The bloods later came back as positive for meningococcal septaceamia. 
Without fast treatment for Sepsis, it can be fatal.

attributes.action: Make overtime tax free
attributes.background: We pay tax on our standard hours so we should get our overtime tax free

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on the UK remaining/leaving the Customs Union
attributes.background: In 2016 the British people voted to leave the EU . However there’s still no consensus on what form a Brexit can take which has caused much conflict on issues like trade and the Irish border .A simple solution would be to allow the electorate to decide if we leave or remain in the Customs Union.

attributes.action: All councils should be required by law to collect waste bins once per week
attributes.background: Many councils choose to collect bins every 2 weeks. This results in bin bags being stacked up on the ground, which creates a hatchery for flies. Fly eggs become adult flies in as little as 10 days, so this collection period allows full generations to grow, transferring disease to humans.
attributes.additional_details: Flies carry bacteria that is very harmful to humans, including salmonella, typhoid, gastroenteritis, E.coli, dysentery and even tuberculosis. They can also carry viruses and even parasitic worms. They transfer these to humans by landing in dirty environments such as bins, dead animals, and animal waste, and then landing on our food and food preparation surfaces, cutlery and plates on draining boards, tap handles, etc. The transfer happens within seconds of them landing on a surface.

attributes.action: Ban the riding of bicycles while walking dogs.
attributes.background: On a regular basis, I see people riding a bicycle while they take their dog for a walk. This is highly dangerous if the dog wants to stop to do their business as on many occasions, the rider is not even paying attention to their dog, which could cause severe injury to the dog.

attributes.action: Pass a law to prevent landlords refusing people to have pets.
attributes.background: We request you pass a law that forbids landlords to deny tenants a pet as it will prove beneficial for people and animals alike.
attributes.additional_details: Having pets has been proved to be very beneficial for health, lowering blood pressure, helping with stress etc. For people living alone they are companionship. For children, it educates them about caring and having compassion for other living creatures along with responsibility of such. With so many animal shelters full, the problem is being exhasperated by private landlords denying people a basic right to have a pet. For time immemorial people have kept animals as pets and surely it is within their human rights to do so.

attributes.action: Change the law on drink driving to no drink at all while in charge of a vehicle
attributes.background: Stop drinking while driving completely, as in you cannot have any alcohol while in charge of any vehichle! To many people lose there loves one through someone else's irresponsible actions, yet all they get in return of taking a life is a couple years in prison at the most.
attributes.additional_details: We need a tougher punishment for this crime such as longer prison time and harsher license loss, if over the limit if you cause an accident it should be you lose your license for more than 5 years followed by a prison sentence minimum punishment. UK laws are to lax time to make them tougher. Save lives not lose them!!

attributes.action: Limit MP's to a total of 4 years in parliament to prevent career politicians.
attributes.background: A politician should only be allowed to serve 4 years (consecutive or not) in parliament to prevent the blatant complacency and contempt for the British public that has been on display for years.
attributes.additional_details:
A politician with a limited timescale has to make their term count. Would the country stall on any major decision if politicians knew they could do what they believed was best for the country without fear of losing their ‘golden goose’ career? 
Fresh blood is required to bring new ideas and a fresh perspective to the way this country is run. New and exciting representatives are out there waiting for their chance to make a difference for the country, and they should be given the chance.

attributes.action: Keep Beechen Cliff as a state school as supported by parents and pupils
attributes.background:
The government are querying whether to close Beechen Cliff school in Bath due to a recent Ofsted report. This report was a shock to pupils, teachers and parents and in no way reflects the school.
Please sign this petition to stop the government withdrawing funding and closing the school

attributes.action: Make health and nutrition a compulsory subject at Key Stage 2 and 3 level.
attributes.background: Childhood obesity is at its highest level ever in the UK and this is mainly due to a combination of lack of education in the majority of both adults and children, and misinformation spread by companies in order to sell products. By incorporating these subject in to KS2 and 3 it is providing the next
attributes.additional_details: Generation with the ability to make correctly informed choices about the foods they choose to consume.

attributes.action: Raise Firefighters' wages to a reasonable living wage (+ all emergency services)
attributes.background: The fire fighters are real life heroes risking their own life and limb, running into danger, for the sake of others and their property. Their wages, along with ALL other emergency service workers, have been frozen and capped instead of being given the recognition they deserve.
attributes.additional_details:
Statement of a firefighter: “Personally I go to work to earn money to provide for my family and myself.  In my mind all public services work extremely hard (Police, Fire, Ambulance or our nurses and doctors).  Our pay was frozen, then capped at 1% whilst inflation has risen at about 3%, our pension contributions have risen and the NI contributions we pay so, in effect, our wages have dropped.” 

ALL emergency services deserve a decent living wage and appropriate funding for volunteer agencies.

attributes.action: Remove the 'minimum ban' on drink drivers and replace with a lifetime ban
attributes.background:
Currently the law in the UK states that drink driving offenders MAY GET, 6 months’ imprisonment, 
an unlimited fine, a driving ban for at least 1 year (3 years if convicted twice in 10 years)
attributes.additional_details:
These dangerous people should be taken off the road for good and the penalties for those who offend should be a lot stricter. An example must be made.
Almost 1 in 4 drink driving offenders return to court for the same offence in the UK.

attributes.action: Re-skill ALL shop floor workers who have been made redundant in 2018 onwards.
attributes.background: Around 30,000 jobs have been lost or at risk since Jan 1 2018. The British Retail Consortium are predicting that up to 1m jobs could be lost or at risk by 2020 in UK Retailing. Every shop worker should be given FREE training to start a new digital career in online retailing.

attributes.action: Government to urge all countries ban trophy hunting.
attributes.background: I believe the UK Government should put all the pressure it can to make Trophy Hunting illegal worldwide. If we do not do something magnificent creatures will be lost for future generations. I would also like to be illegal to kill a similar creature in Britain.
attributes.additional_details: Trophy hunters are killing 70,000 animals ever year.

attributes.action: Establish quorum and meaningful majority criteria to validate future referenda.
attributes.background: Referendums are affecting the future of the UK. A 50.1% majority is slight and have left nearly half the electorate unsatisfied and discontented. Criteria such as the definition of a quorum would establish the initial validity of the referendum and more accurately reflect the will of the electorate.

attributes.action: Mobility scooters users should be licenced, insured and pass a handling test.
attributes.background: To help prevent more members of the general public being injured, as i was recently, by one of these large, heavy, unregulated vehicles driven without due care in public places.

attributes.action: Make high blood pressure tablets free on the NHS
attributes.background: Over 5 million people have high blood pressure and it affects more than 1 in 4 adults and is one of the biggest risk factors for premature death and disability in England.High blood pressure can lead to diseases including heart disease, stroke, vascular dementia and chronic kidney disease.
attributes.additional_details: People who treat their diabetes with tablets, injection therapies or insulin are entitled to free prescriptions – but if you're in England you'll need to have a medical exemption certificate to claim your free prescription unless you're aged 60 or over. High blood pressure affects more people and have the same potential to kill a sufferer as someone with diabetes. High blood pressure sufferers right across the UK should be treated equally and fairly as diabetics and get free medication

attributes.action: Ban smoking around schools and nurseries premises
attributes.background: Since I have started doing school runs I have increasingly noticed the amount of parents/carers who gather at the school gates, sometimes having toddlers with them, and smoke while discussing the day. I believe it is general knowledge to all of how harmful smoking and second hand smoking are.
attributes.additional_details: Banning smoking in public places had been a great intervention, however many still do it at bus stops and play areas or while pushing a pram... I start this petition as I feel that we need to start somewhere protecting the children from the harmful chemicals or at least raising more awareness around it. I also feel it would be relevant to the Public Health England policy drivers regarding smoking cessation.

attributes.action: Year 10 & Year 11 students should focus on GCSEs and not have to do PE.
attributes.background: Secondary schools are forcing children in year 10 and year 11 to do PE (physical education), in other words sports. It should be a choice at GCSE to do PE. If the student has chosen Sports as a GCSE then they should do PE however if students did not pick Sports they should not be forced to do PE!
attributes.additional_details: Children should be focusing on their GCSEs and achieving high grades which will help further along in the education system, yet secondary schools are forcing children to do PE. Other subject will benefit the children more such as math. If the child is doing an average of 1 hour of PE a week, over the course of 39 weeks (average school year) it comes to a total of 78 hours from year 10-11. Definitely too many hours. This can be split up for other lessons which will help support the child better.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory to get a licence to own an animal.
attributes.background: This is a petition to make anybody who wants to own any animal have a licence. There is so much animal abuse that goes on and this is a step in the right direction to start protecting innocent creatures. With a view to the licence fee being used to police animal cruelty at street level.
attributes.additional_details: The licence would ideally be linked with an animal abusers register that is also being petitioned for. Please remember that if nobody speaks up, nothing will change, and animals do not have a voice. We are their voice and we have to be heard. Thankyou.

attributes.action: The N.H.S should fund properly regulated homeopathy clinics.
attributes.background: Millions around the world and in the U.K choose homeopathy instead of mainstream medicine, until recently the N.H.S funded some G.P's who prescribed homeopathic remedy's but the N.H.S has now stopped this.

attributes.action: Make it law that people have to vote, same as Australia
attributes.background: Make it law in the UK that people have to vote unless they have a legitimate reason not to. If they don't vote and don't have a legitimate reason then they should get fined.
attributes.additional_details: This needs to happen as the amount of people who do vote is appalling and numbers need to rise.

attributes.action: Raise Awarness for Morgellons Disease and co infections eg: Lymes Disease
attributes.background: I was bitten by a tick in the uk in 2011 I didn’t seek treatment as I didn’t no the risks. I was very ill over a number of years losing my hair etc. It was only when fibres started to come from my skin that I was diagnosed with Morgellons Disease a chronic form of Lymes Disease caused by the tick
attributes.additional_details: I am now under treatment but can’t be cured. Yet this Disease is still not recognised as a genuine illness as over the years patients have been dismissed as being dillusional. I am under a Dermatologist at the Royal London Hospital. Who states this is not a dillusion! The Disease needs listing on the rare disease register

attributes.action: Attach a mandatory Prison term to every charged Drink Driving case
attributes.background: Charged Drink Driving offences rarely carry any prison sentence and those with the money can easily afford any fine or ban. Adding a mandatory jail sentence should again make people think twice regardless of their status.
attributes.additional_details: Celebrities getting off with just fines and bans.

attributes.action: Create a Strategic Marine Resources Act
attributes.background:
Promote the protection of marine resources in the UK/British EEZ's
Safe guard UK fisheries within UK/British EEZ's post Brexit
Create and protect a sustainable asset for the UK
attributes.additional_details:
Under the UNCLOS each country has an EEZ and the protection of this natural resource is an important part of the members commitment.

The UK has no Strategic Fisheries Resources Act, and it does not have a Strategic Maritime Resources Act.

attributes.action: Extend the remit of Employment Tribunals to include all equality-related cases
attributes.background: Employment Tribunals should become Employment & Equality Tribunals and hear all equality-related cases. Why have an Equality Act if only employees have access to legal redress? The Government must ensure that everyone, including pensioners and students, has equal access to justice at equal cost.
attributes.additional_details: The additional burden on the tribunal system would be small compared with the huge difference the change would make to those suffering breaches of the law. If the government won't extend the remit, they must explain why disabled students have fewer rights than disabled employees. An employee with a discrimination claim can go to the tribunal, but if someone other than their employer discriminates against them, they have to file an expensive claim in the County Court or the High Court.

attributes.action: Legally require the Net Internal Floor area to be quoted for every home on sale.
attributes.background: Homes in Britain are traded in terms of rooms rather than floor space. This lack of clear information is a source of market failure. British homes are getting more cramped and less fit for purpose.
attributes.additional_details: There are no minimum space standards for new housing in Britain. Research by CABE and LABC Warranty shows that developers are making homes smaller and smaller. New homes lack space for family meals, for childrens play and homework, and for storage. Quoting the Net Internal Floor area (e.g. as defined by the Valuation Office Agency) would help buyers understand exactly what they are getting, make objective comparisons, and identify value for money.

attributes.action: Ban people from smoking inside all local authority/ association owned houses
attributes.background:
Banning smoking in local authority/association owned houses will reduce passive smoking which other people in the property do not want to inhale. 

It will reduce the amount of fire damage that could occur if the cigarette isn't extinguished properly
attributes.additional_details:
It can stop potential nuisance of litter been thrown from windows into neighbours gardens and the street better for the environment and less encouragement to rats 

May reduce smoking rate so people may quit and become healthier

attributes.action: Make feminine hygiene products free.
attributes.background: Women are expected to pay a significant amount of their income each month to pay for essential feminine hygiene products. The process women go through is completely natural and not their choice. The idea that they pay for such necessary products while contraception can be free is ridiculous.
attributes.additional_details: The average woman's income annually is £22,381. Take out their tax and their personal allowance. They spend £2,160 approximately on food annually and approx £492 annually on feminine hygiene products. That's money that could be better spent on themselves or on their families. For low income women and students who struggle to eat, this is atrocious. They are still finding the money to look after their bodies. The government should start to pay for such products.

attributes.action: Make 30th November a national holiday in memory of Sir Winston Churchill
attributes.background: Sir Winston Leonard Spencer-Churchill, was a great national hero. A man who epitomized the British spirit during one of our nation's darkest times. In honour of this man, his birthday each year should be made a national holiday to commemorate him.

attributes.action: Ask the EU under Article 50(3) TFEU to extend the period before Brexit
attributes.background: Our future as a global trading nation hangs on our future relationship with the EU. That is far from certain and we need time to develop it. Once we leave the EU, our position will be weaker across the board. We should not  burn that bridge and move into the transition without more clarity.
attributes.additional_details: During the proposed transition, the UK will be a rule-taker, not a rule-maker. It will be able to sign – but not implement- trade agreements with partners outside the EU. There is no clear evidence of the availability, terms or value of such deals, and potential partners will wish to know the UK's future relationship with the EU before committing themselves. The Transition is too uncertain. We should not leave our existing terms with the EU before we are sure we are headed for a better future.

attributes.action: If you are an English citizen, you should not have to pay to attend university.
attributes.background: In Scotland, you do not have to pay to attend university, however, English citizens have to pay extortionate amounts just to get education. Without this education, many young people will not get the chances that their futures' deserve. You can change all this with just a vote.

attributes.action: Working people should be awarded 100% of the non working partners tax allowance
attributes.background: Every UK citizen is intitled to tax free income of 11500 pa. The fact that in a family unit only one person may be in full time employment while the other person may be at home bringing up children is not a good reason to financially penalise that family or any other in a similar position.

attributes.action: Remove Homework in all primary schools in England
attributes.background:
Child mental health is in the spotlight all the time - however pressures being placed on children under 11 is at an all time high.

The pressure placed on children under 11 from primary schools could be taken as being one of the root causes as well as lack of social skills.
attributes.additional_details:
Homework is is a burden on the students personal life, they already spend a lot of their week in school and it should be then that they learn.

Time outside of school should be left to the pupils to rest and take part in social activities so that they can make the most of their time in school without feeling tired and stressed and learn to have social skills outside of school.

If a working adult was asked to take work home each night they would not be happy with this and would not complete it.

attributes.action: Give anyone who has a long-term health condition medication on the NHS
attributes.background:
Some people end up needing hospital treatment because they cannot afford their medication. 

Health officials say they have made sure people with chronic illnesses have access to affordable prescription but the current system is arbitrary and unfair.
attributes.additional_details: People with Diabetes have their medication and equipments on the NHS but what about people who have the leading cause of death being Heart Disease in the UK/World-wide? Conditions such as Heart Disease, Crohns or Parkinson's etc should be available on the NHS, doing this could save thousands of lives.

attributes.action: Make the using mobile phone whilst driving punishment the same as drink driving.
attributes.background: I see at least 10 people a day using their phone whilst driving they are not concentrating on the road or they're holding the traffic up because they are too busy looking at their phone. The ban should be the same as drink driving because they are not looking at the road.

attributes.action: Debate harmful effects of Balloon releasing.
attributes.background: Plastic in the seas is becoming more widely known. Releasing balloons is harmful to the environment, affecting land animals, sea mammals, creatures and is eventually ingested by fish. Research has found it is consumed by humans and pets via micro-plastics. Beaches are littered with enough rubbish.
